entry.title: Big Bother
entry.content:
Big Bother is watching you… and you too.

Big Bother (sic) is a generative sketch that features an eye on a large screen. This eye has the ability to mutate a little when it detects movement around: a new pupil appears to follow every “target”, with the aim to follow each watcher individually.

This piece is currently being displayed on a huge screen in the center of Madrid, as part of MediaLab Prado’s #ProgramaLaPlazaÂ call for projects.

You can check and tweak the code here, and see other submitted projects here.

entry.title: Terra Cognita
entry.content:
As I moved to Berlin in 2012 I started tracking my first movements in the city, so that I could visualize the process itself of gradually discovering a new place.

The speed at which my coordinates move is mapped into different colors, so one can easily guess if I was walking (green), taking the train or a car (red), the tram (purple) or even riding a bike (blue).

The code is at https://github.com/jperals/terra-cognita.

entry.title: Wallball
entry.content:
Wallball is a simple gesture-based game made with Box2D and Processing.

Draw lines which will become “walls”. These “walls” need to touch one ball of each colour (red, green and blue) in order to disappear. When a wall disappears it will give you points.

But be careful to not get the balls trapped between your walls and the top of the screen! When this happens the game will end.

Read more or just play.
